revised_title: The Royal Society's History of Trades Programme and its Impact on Industrial Revolution
tldr: The Royal Society's history of trades programme, initiated in the 17th century, aimed to revolutionize industry by studying and documenting trades. Although it did not dramatically affect the industry at the time, the programme contributed to the development of new attitudes towards industry, which eventually led to the Industrial Revolution. The programme also played a crucial role in transferring craft knowledge to industry-supported scholars, laying the foundation for the modern scientific-technological revolution.
